content: joseph s ladder wreath by lettice rose i love the look of jacob s ladder and started toying with the idea of latching up long post stitches instead of chain loops so being a christmas square i thought it could be called joseph s ladder instead of jacob s i also wanted to provide a nice little plaque area to embroider the date and initials on your blanket in true sampler style if you don t fancy doing this i have added an alternative holly sprig for the centre or leave it plain and simple yarn and hook sample made in stylecraft special dk a = khaki b = cream c = meadow d = lipstick written in us terms worked with worsted weight yarn and an h/8/5mm hook measures approximately 12 worked with dk weight yarn and a g/6/4mm hook measures approximately 9 5 you also need stitch markers a darning needle and a large 7-9mm hook joseph s ladder wreath © 2023 lettice rose 1 stitches and abbreviations chain = chain half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch skip stitch = skip double_crochet = double_crochet yarn over = yo quadruple treble = qtr back post half_double_crochet = bphdc single_crochet =single_crochet space = space place marker= pm wrong side = ws special stitches mini popcorn mpc 4 half_double_crochet in same st remove hook from work insert in 1st half_double_crochet put loop back on hook and pull through for the starting mpc use either chain 2 or a standing half_double_crochet to begin picot chain 3 slip_stitch in 3rd chain from hook quadruple treble_crochet qtr work as treble_crochet but wrap yo 5 times at beginning of stitch instructions the design was originally intended to offer a plain plaque area to embroider initials or dates to personalise your blanket however you may prefer to add a holly sprig as a finishing touch or any other small flower motif you fancy to make it even more individual holly sprig if you prefer a holly sprig in the centre of the wreath make this first and it will be fixed to the square in round 4 leave the yarn tails for now with yarn a leaving a 6 tail chain 1 picot chain 1 pm in chain picot x 3 single_crochet in marked chain slip_stitch in base of 1st picot picot slip_stitch in base of 1st picot slip_stitch in starting chain x 3 slip_stitch in 1st chain of 1st leaf to join pull yarn through and cut off leaving a 6 tail set aside for later joseph s ladder wreath © 2023 lettice double_crochet double_crochet in same st 2 double_crochet in each of next 11 double_crochet slip_stitch to top of starting chain to close 24 double_crochet round 3 chain 3 as 1st double_crochet
